name: Pasley: Zhou Yu
description: Zhou Yu, surnamed Gong Jin, was a famous general at the end of the Eastern Han Dynasty. He was eight buckets tall, literary and martial arts strategy, and dignified in appearance. First, he assisted Sun Ce to pacure Jiangdong, and then assisted Sun Quan to divide the world with Liu Bei and Cao Cao. In the 14th year of Jian'an, he was appointed as a partial general and commanded the governor of Nan County.
